remarks: A second or higher power of a rational number is not a prime number.  Or by contraposition, the n-th root of a prime number is irrational. Suggested by Norm Megill.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Aug-2015.)
statement: expnprm $p |- ( ( A e. QQ /\ N e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) ) -> -. ( A ^ N ) e. Prime ) $.
